website_summaries.verdict: A low-cost tile cutter that's suitable for light-duty cutting jobs only.
pros: The budget price will suit some users very well, particularly those who are cutting ceramic or glass tile
cons: It's not strong enough to handle slate tile or other heavy-duty tile materials

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for small vintage bathroom repairs
customer_reviews.text: Only had a few tiles to cut so I bought the least expensive tile cutter. Watched a few videos first to make sure I understood how to use the contraption, then practiced once on a spare tile. I'm using the cheapest white 3x6 tiles from Home Depot that cost about 15 cents each and this cut clean with a nice, satisfying snap. Not sure how it would hold up over a large flooring job but can't see why it wouldn't. It feels solid and has a nice heft to it. No problems at all and worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Ida

customer_reviews.title: Meh, you get what you pay for...
customer_reviews.text: I needed to cut approximately 8-9 tiles for a small area in front of a fireplace. That is all this tool is good for. You need to have a little "know how" or skill to use tile cutters so buying a cheaply made one with lots of plastic parts which are not very stable doesn't help. I suspect you could replace the cutting wheel, but it wouldn't even be worth it since the actual unit isn't very good. For me, I got just OK cuts, broke some tiles for a small area. Don't even think of using this for big jobs, back splashes, bathrooms, floors, etc. Spend some money on a quality DIY homeowner one.
customer_reviews.author: Speegee

customer_reviews.title: Effective, budget tile cutter.
customer_reviews.text: I'd give it 2 stars if I had paid more money, but at some point you have to accept relative quality for what you paid. Not a professional tool for extended use or large projects. Scores and snaps very well, but I found myself having to 'eye-down' the cut line in lieu of trusting the base layout / alignment. I used it for about 60 sq.ft. of 3/8" Carrera Marble and achieved acceptable results.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T

customer_reviews.title: Does not make square cuts
customer_reviews.text: This item does not make square/straight cuts. The difference on a 12" tile is 1/8". If you are a pro, this might be acceptable. Unfortunately, I am not a pro so 1/8" make a big difference for me. I ended up taking the tile and re-cutting it on my wet saw. I only bought this cutter so I could save time making straight cuts. I ended up take twice as long. I will try and return this item.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Midkiff

customer_reviews.title: Quieter and clean cut
customer_reviews.text: Not bad at all!! Better, quieter and less messy than getting peed all over by my wet saw. I hope to accomplish the same with a sheet of glass mosaic tiles.
customer_reviews.author: RSC

customer_reviews.title: Run away from this piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: Absolute piece of garbage. Fence is not square, cut is off 1/8-3/16 over a 3” span. Don’t waste your time with this as it will lead to nothing but frustration.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worth the small investment!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for glass tile work. A saw just makes a horrible mess. It is easy to use and creates very clean cuts. Only weakness is that the arm that applies pressure to the tile is small so trying to make long narrow cuts sometimes results in broken tiles. UPDATE: during my second tiling project the foot that applies pressure to the tile to snap it broke. I was only working with 6 inch wide porcelain. Disappointed with the durability. I snapped the rest by hand and will try a different brand if another tiling job arises.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor T

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and a solid product
customer_reviews.text: I have used similar tile cutters in the past with mixed results. I was impressed by the size, weight and overall feel of quality with this cutter. I was using it to cut backsplash subway tiles and it worked perfectly. The blade scores nice and crisply and the snap of the tile is perfect. This was a very good value and I can recommend it for wall tile and possibly larger tiles, but I haven't tested it on floor tiles yet.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Won't cut 5/16 porcelain tiles
customer_reviews.text: I needed a tile cutter to save me the constant trips to garage where I had my wet saw. I have 2 types of tiles - 5/16" thick porcelain tile and 5/16" subway tile. I purchased this cutter as it was mentioned by a Youtuber. When it arrived I immediately tried it on tiles: 5/16" porcelain tile - this cutter won't cut it, too much flex. If I press any harder I think the cutter will break. 5/16" ceramic subway tile - it cuts it easily, but the problem is that the cut line is 1/8 off the cutter's marked center, making it very hard to cut accurately. It's useless for my project so I am sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Rusted In Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Solid, but make sure everything is aligned.
customer_reviews.text: Works as you would expect. Definitely do a couple test cuts to make sure everything is aligned. I used this on subway tile and it is clear that the scoring is not perfectly perpendicular to the top as my cuts were at a slight but noticeable angle, even on small 4x6 tile. Cutter is solid and well built, save for the plastic measurement slider at the top. Great for smaller projects.
customer_reviews.author: Codey F.

customer_reviews.title: F
customer_reviews.text: I know it's a cheap tile cutter but I rather spend those $20 bucks on gas or anything else instead of throwing them away in something that is worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Ramoday

customer_reviews.title: I will tile everything now!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this couldn’t possible be that great at that price, and it’s super light.... But I was wrong! I’m heading into my second thin brick project ( I borrowed a wet dry electric tile table saw for the last one) and this thing works like a charm! I wish it didn’t because there are other projects mounting in my head....
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Eazor

customer_reviews.title: Tile Cutter Worked Great!
customer_reviews.text: I had a small tile job, cutting 3 X 12 glass tile for a back splash on a new kitchen counter top. This worked great. It scored to tile with one pass and snapped clean. I don't know the durability for a big job, but for me, I was very pleased. Cheaper than renting one and now I have it for future jobs. Price was great!
customer_reviews.author: Mombom

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get a straight cut
customer_reviews.text: Always cut on an angle, was very hard to get it to make a straight cut. Had to hold tiles on a slight angle and eye ball each cut to get a straight cut. a lot of play in the cutting wheel. It does cut the tiles OK.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Margo

customer_reviews.title: Crappy machine and low quality construction.
customer_reviews.text: This should be more appropriate as a prop tool than an actual tool. Flimsy construction and smells like chemicals upon arrival. Made in China.
customer_reviews.author: Max™

customer_reviews.title: Value for money, not professional but can get the job done for small DIY projects
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works and cuts the tiles. Great value for money . Cannot do small cuts like 1/4 inch or 1/2 inch cuts . Also straight cut can be tricky, I never got a straight cut but was able fo get basic cuts I needed for my project.
customer_reviews.author: BNKV

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: If all you need to do is cut tile in half or close to it, this product works great. The lines it cuts are near perfect and without jagged edges. If you need to cut small, thinner pieces off tile and more detail work, I would recommend a wet saw instead.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I used it once, and the cheap parts broke. You can just tell the quality of the metal used in this is crappy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Wild

customer_reviews.title: Did the job
customer_reviews.text: It did the job and helped me make straight cuts for glass tiles. Definitely nothing fancy, and not exactly the most accurate, but I guess you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This product is a waste of money!! It is broken and does not slide and shatters your tile!! Please dont waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Anne Turner

customer_reviews.title: Very easy and nice
customer_reviews.text: It’s very good and easy to use but if you got tile longer or wider I think is better if you use bigger one anyway I was able to use and finish job of almost 450sf no problem with only one cuttin and price is good
customer_reviews.author: Wunderkind1

customer_reviews.title: clean cut 14" title
customer_reviews.text: Clean cut, but do take time to align both end of title (on one end, the title is hidden under the tool bars so it isn't easy to align)
customer_reviews.author: B. Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: The casting that holds the scoring arm broke after the third tile. Directions say not force snap the tile. However, it takes some pressure to snap the tile. Impossible to know how much pressure is too much.
customer_reviews.author: alphadog

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy application !
customer_reviews.text: Ok this cutter is ok for small jobs and only for ceramic tile cutting I used with a combination glass, stone and ceramic tile combination pieces. It was a challenge to say the least. Base is plastic but does the job. Scores and breaks very well using ceramic tile only. Worth the money for weekend warrior jobs. Tiled the whole area above my shower surround and it did the job.
customer_reviews.author: HarleyRiderForLife

customer_reviews.title: great product, great price
customer_reviews.text: Did a subway tile job and this cutter was perfect. every slice right on the line and none broke. Wonderful tool.
customer_reviews.author: Nani Oakley

customer_reviews.title: Happy Tiler
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my son and he is loving it. He said it makes his tile cutting so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for cutting ceramic tile
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for cutting ceramic tile. Mark the tile first and do not rely on the guide at the top, it is flimsy. Good value for the low cost.
customer_reviews.author: C. Leavitt

customer_reviews.title: Value
customer_reviews.text: For the price, no better deal. However, if you want "precision" cuts, definitely get a wet saw. But, for the tool to college a job where additional trim is added, it's absolutely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Cutter
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a simple tile cutter - cheap & easy to go with my wet saw. This worked great on my ceramic subway tiles.
customer_reviews.author: South Texas

customer_reviews.title: Good for DIY.
customer_reviews.text: Good tile cutter for a simple job. Too many tricky cuts and I’d get something more technical. I could tile my shower though with this and tile nippers just fine. Also having my own and not renting a power tool allowed me to take my time laying the tile and not rush.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tile cutter, highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT CUTTER! I did have to get a wet saw for very small cuts and specific angles, but for basic straight cuts, this is your man. I was working with 2x6 subway tiles and I could cut thin slivers down to 3/4” off if needed. Great cutter for basic jobs!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Woodward

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product - cut my GLASS backsplash tiles with EASE! great buy!
customer_reviews.author: deniser

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was great. used it on 1" glass tiles. Great tool.
customer_reviews.author: DDX77

customer_reviews.title: Simple cuts
customer_reviews.text: Loved this! This made in house quick cuts much faster and easier than heading out to the tile saw ever few minutes. Accurate cut, easy to operate.
customer_reviews.author: Dori C.

customer_reviews.title: For the price, can't beat it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to cut glass tiles for my camper backsplash. I would have given it five stars because it works great but there is a bit of a learning curve. I used two of the tiles to practice a few times before I got the hang of using it.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Googins

customer_reviews.title: Sucks save your money
customer_reviews.text: This product is garbage save your money this doesn't cut anything
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth D.

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money for a do it your selfer
customer_reviews.text: It was better than I thought it was going to be
customer_reviews.author: Ken dog

customer_reviews.title: Good but came damaged
customer_reviews.text: Product cuts the tiles well, however, the product came with a dent on the right side of the base, causing the entire device to be uneven. I actually had to remove the ruler and leveling part and cut the tiles from the other side or they were more prone to bad cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Louis

customer_reviews.title: This is for straight cuts so corners you make you have to be creative.
customer_reviews.text: It worked perfectly for out plank tiles. The corners were tricky but it is a easy to use product.
customer_reviews.author: Helen Copeland

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Cut Tile
customer_reviews.text: I have a broken right hand, so being able to use this with just one hand, cutting perfectly is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: DH

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first but then wouldn't break straight on any size. Tried several kinds of tile with same disappointing results.
customer_reviews.author: esther wheat

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great for small jobs. Great value. Only problem was slight curve at cut. Could be my scoring, but did the job.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Maute

customer_reviews.title: Difficult for me
customer_reviews.text: I Couldn’t brake the tile in 2 no matter how much strength I put in it , at least not For Porcelain or maybe isn’t for the strengh Of a woman?
customer_reviews.author: Ivon

customer_reviews.title: broke first try :(
customer_reviews.text: This broke the first time I tried to use it. Got returned the next day.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Less mess perfect for smaller jobs
customer_reviews.text: Less mess and easy to use and set up. The plastic bracket on the outside cracked and I don't remember being that rough on it. Oh well still works
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: great for the price
customer_reviews.text: good overall qaulity. handled 8mm ceramic tile and 10mm porcelin tile with no issue
customer_reviews.author: M.Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Used and broken. Advertised as brand new
customer_reviews.text: The “new” tile cutter was sent clearly well used. In fact, the edge was broken, the scoring wheel is chipped, and the arm was broken and taped to the body. Aweful. Very disapointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cutter - I think?
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tile cutter for the price. Seems sturdy enough - I would say it was a very good value! Held the tile in place nicely for accurate scoring. But I bought some REALLY cheap tile (69-cents per square foot) and despite my best efforts with this cutter - that stupid tile wouldn't cut straight. Kept breaking along arced lines - ACK! Took the tile back to the big-box retailer I bought it from, where they cut it with their wet saw (and admitted it was awful tile). So the moral of this tale is that even a nice tile cutter like this might not work with cr@ppy tile....LOL!
customer_reviews.author: D. Masselink

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price. If used for only straight cuts, it is just fine. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: SJGUSMC21

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for the do it yourselfer.
customer_reviews.text: If you just have a do-it-yourself type of job around the house this tile cutter works great, it's not something you would use as a pro or if you're tiling an extremely large job, but for a kitchen or bathroom remodel this will work just fine for you. I've cut both ceramic and porcelain tile and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cody

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love this tile cutter. It is light weight but sharp... gives clean cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley A. Massicotte

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine on full tiles cut in the middle but close to the end,could not snap.
customer_reviews.author: bill galley

customer_reviews.title: Easy for small projects
customer_reviews.text: I’m not a handy person, but this was easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: N. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great value , not precision tool tho
customer_reviews.text: Worked great , small project , not a precision tool tho !
customer_reviews.author: IAN LEWIS

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Cheap but good quality. Worked for tile work in two bathrooms so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kareltry

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I used it for cutting small tiles and it it worked pretty good
customer_reviews.author: Najat Ghafri

customer_reviews.title: Product worked well for the bathroom renovation. The plastic ...
customer_reviews.text: Product worked well for the bathroom renovation. The plastic sides are flimsy and one side was cracked when it arrived but did not hinder use.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Daly

customer_reviews.title: ... tiles of various widths and they all came out great. just
customer_reviews.text: cut a bunch of porcelain tiles of various widths and they all came out great. just watch the online youtube before you start for best results.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Film Guys

customer_reviews.title: Good option if you don't want to drag out a tile saw.
customer_reviews.text: Worked pretty well...couldn't get a saw-type-of-accurate cut, but TONS less mess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very affordable for a small tiling job, no problems with function.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Tile cutter for home use!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to use with accurate clean cuts...I am very happy with this tool for lighter weight tile work. Great value!
customer_reviews.author: pamela travis

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price! Did a whole bathroom using this for straight cuts
customer_reviews.author: Angelica

customer_reviews.title: Why do people even use wet saws?
customer_reviews.text: This thing is freaking awesome. I am tiling my kitchen right now with ceramic 3x6 subway tiles and for straight cuts, this thing is great! HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: katehopeeden

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: First tile job and this thing saved me a bunch will recommend too others good bang for the buck
customer_reviews.author: jordan

customer_reviews.title: Not good for very thin stones
customer_reviews.text: Meh. Okay for simple cuts. Not good for very thin stones.
customer_reviews.author: theChivefan

customer_reviews.title: Great product and great price
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my bathroom. Cut lot better than what I thought it would. Definitely a good investment. I used it for cermic tile.
customer_reviews.author: cameron L.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works fine unless you have a lot of angle cuts. Sand the cut edges for a better finish
customer_reviews.author: jbo

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Save up and get a 60$ wet saw....this is crap
customer_reviews.author: BB0728

customer_reviews.title: No instructions.
customer_reviews.text: No instructions and no paper saying what link to go to for online instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap. Not inexpensive.
customer_reviews.text: Handle broke out of the plastic body when I was 80% complete. Headed to Lowe’s so I can keep working.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Dickson

customer_reviews.title: Beginners best choice.
customer_reviews.text: Cuts clean as expected. Easy to use even for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cut!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I've only used it on ceramic tile, but I'm very happily with it.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My bathroom now has new ceramic tile on the floor. This tool made it a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Larry A. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Good cutter for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Good tile cutter for the money. Did a nice job of cutting 13inch tile.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Christman II

customer_reviews.title: Good tile cuter
customer_reviews.text: It is a little difficult to see the scoring tool and get it lined up with your lime but once done the tool works great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Palmer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It cuts tile as advertised. I can even be able to cut tile into small 1"x1"
customer_reviews.author: pharn

customer_reviews.title: Cheap pllastic!
customer_reviews.text: Didnt even get to use it, the first time i lifted the handle and pushed down the arm broke off, uts plastic where the arm goes into the cutter
customer_reviews.author: Shelley

customer_reviews.title: Worked well
customer_reviews.text: It worked well. I'm glad I didn't buy a tile saw.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel G.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: nice and solid, will do the job if youre a DIY'er
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: not very durable
customer_reviews.text: Worked ok for about a dozen cuts, then the breaker foot snapped. Ended up finishing the job by scoring with this tool then breaking the tile on my knee. If I were doing this over again I would invest the extra in a cheap tile saw. (only $30 at the time of this review.)
customer_reviews.author: dartanion42

customer_reviews.title: it still did not make good cuts. Plus it was extremely hard to push ...
customer_reviews.text: I found this exceptionally hard to cut tile with. Even after multiple passes and pressing hard, it still did not make good cuts. Plus it was extremely hard to push the cutter while pressing. Others I've used were much better. Should've gone with a better one from Home Depot
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality for the price. Worked well on my back splash.
customer_reviews.author: jlf

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Complete junk. The tile cutting wheel is hardly sharp and the prong to brake the tile broke before the tile did. After cutting 6 tiles I now have a piece of trash. Worthless.
customer_reviews.author: MYK

customer_reviews.title: Performed as expected. Not the most precise instrument. ...
customer_reviews.text: Performed as expected. Not the most precise instrument. The base is plastic and the entire tool is light, so you have to hold the base while scoring. The scoring assembly was a bit tight to slide, but I did not care to lubricate.
customer_reviews.author: Elina B.

customer_reviews.title: IMHO not a very functional tool. I gave up ...
customer_reviews.text: IMHO not a very functional tool. I gave up after breaking a number of glass tiles. Instead I rigged my wet saw in in to make cuts I needed
customer_reviews.author: Solarbears

customer_reviews.title: The product probably works fine. But I needed a small amount of ends ...
customer_reviews.text: The product probably works fine. But I needed a small amount of ends cut off, and it cracked two of my three tiles. If you arent cutting down the middle you may need an actual cutter. Otherwise, while it didnt work for what I needed it for, it's a handy tool.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed with this product
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed with this product. I bought the tile cutter to cut glass. the cutter does not cut a straight line - it cuts a slight curve. I have used this cutter to cut 30 tiles and the cut is not a clean cut. Can the head already be blunt after such little use.
customer_reviews.author: Miss l

customer_reviews.title: I wasted lots of glass tiles because I thought I was ...
customer_reviews.text: Dont buy this item. I dont think this item is quality checked. Doesnt score vertically, it always scores diagonally. Buyers beware!!! I wasted lots of glass tiles because I thought I was doing it wrong, but it I measured the tool itself, its angles is way off!!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine J Espinueva

customer_reviews.title: AD SAID PRODUCT NEW. PACKAGE HAD BEEN OPENED AND ...
customer_reviews.text: AD SAID PRODUCT NEW. PACKAGE HAD BEEN OPENED AND RESEALED. DOESN'T MATTER IEVEN IF IT WORKS AND ARRIVES IN REASONABLE TIME. IF YOU PAY FOR NEW THAT'S WHAT YOU SHOULD GET.
customer_reviews.author: Walter Duda

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just scored our porcelain tiles. Did not cut them at all, no matter how hard my husband tried.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small cutter...BIG tile!
customer_reviews.text: Loved it but could not use it. It was too small for the tile. :(
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra H. Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Not strong enough
customer_reviews.text: This could not manage to break through my porcelain tile. I scored it well and went to break it and the whole tile shattered. Not happy. Wasted one test tile on this and when I was finishing my tile job I had to open up a new box of tile for ONE tile. The one that this thing broke. Costing me $35 to keep extra tile I dont need. What a jerk....
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Never used one before it was so easy to use and did job perfectly
customer_reviews.author: John Grounds

customer_reviews.title: Works on glass tiles
customer_reviews.text: Goal achieved. I purchased the product for a small project and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Good Taste

product_meta.title: M-D Building Products 49194 14-Inch Tile Cutter
feature_bullets: Cast aluminum brackets and cutter assembly
